content: Great substitute for the $100+ monitors you can buy at the store.  It works seamlessly between Apple and Android devices.  We love it, but after using it for over a year, I have found a few things to be aware of: -Be close to a power source. This thing will DRAIN your mobile battery.  I installed the app on my Mac to save my cell battery the abuse.  -Make sure you have reliable Wi-Fi. The monitor only works when connected to the internet and we've had a few cases where we lost connection and woke up to the baby screaming from down the hall (poor kid!) -I JUST learned this today and it's what prompted me to write the review- THE APP SAVES ALL ACTIVITY!  Every time you start monitoring it records every noise made and saves it to your devices memory.  There is no auto-delete setting. I found this because my phone mysteriously ran out of memory and I found 2 GB of it was used by EVERY SINGLE SOUND the baby made on the monitor over the last year.  Devs, if you're reading this , PLEASE patch with a "delete activity log after __ days" setting!  If you don't mind dealing with this sort of stuff, this is a great app substitute for traditional monitors. We love running the Parent Station on multiple devices, being able to check in when we leave him with a sitter, or keeping it running if we're working outside while the baby naps.
replyContent: We're reading this, Tim. :) Thank you for your review and your inputs. We'll definitely have a look at it.

Works great - I've tried a few of these baby monitors- this one is awesome.  I am running this on two old Kyocera devices (Event and Rise) that I got for $10-15 each at radio shack. Video support for android is coming "this summer" according to the developer, but I hope to purchased the iOS and mac apps as well in any case. Even without live video on android, the camera function is excellent and just as good. When the baby wakes up, we can just snap a picture or two - there is even a function to control flash (default is flash off). The microphone sensitivity options are great: very high, high, medium, low, very low. The fact that you can add your baby's name to the device and personalize the colors blue/pink make the app great for multiple kids and devices. There are no extraneous features and you only have to pay once. Connection seems rock solid - I have not tried on cellular yet, but so far everything works really well.
